info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 06 at 2:48PM MST until January 08 at 3:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST FRIDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM FRIDAY TO 3 AM MST SATURDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT 3 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations up to two inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, blowing snow expected. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Fergus and Chouteau Counties. * WHEN...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 AM MST Friday. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, from 1 PM Friday to 3 AM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday evening and Friday morning commutes. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.
